numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph compares students who have the same test scores.

3. The admission chances can fluctuate because of legacy status.
4. The admission chances can fluctuate because of the income rank of a parent.
5. In every income rank, legacy status increases the admission chance.
6. Very wealthy legacy students are 7 times more likely to be admitted than poor non-legacy students who have the same test scores.
7. I think that this difference is unfair.
8. I wonder why a bias exists in college admissions.
9. One reason for this bias is that wealthy families may donate a lot of money to a school.
10. If a wealthy family donates a lot of money to a school then applicants from this family may have an advantage.
11. A wealthy person already has an advantage in life.
12. A wealthy legacy student and a poor legacy student can have the same test scores.
13. A wealthy legacy student and a poor legacy student can have unequal opportunities.
14. If a wealthy legacy student and a poor legacy student have unequal opportunities then societal norms are reinforced.
15. Poor students can be at an inherent disadvantage when they apply to elite colleges.
16. If poor students are at an inherent disadvantage then poor students have fewer opportunities in life.
17. I wonder whether financial aid is a reason for lower admission chances of poorer students.
18. Financial aid is limited.
19. I will apply to colleges soon.
20. Some schools eliminate legacy status.
21. I am not sure how much this graph will affect me.
22. The headline is: Legacy Boost equals Bias.
